intro: Saueria sulcata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Saueria sulcata prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
